turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Luxembourg in World War II.
turn.1: What happened in World War II in Luxembourg?
turn.2: After the Americans in northern Luxembourg were forced to retreat by the German attacks, the area experienced a second passage of the front line during January–February 1945, this time moving generally eastward as the U.S. Third Army attacked into the southern flank of the German penetration (the "Bulge").
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Vianden was the final community in Luxembourg to be liberated on 12 February 1945.
turn.6: Because of the determination of both sides to prevail on the battlefield, the combat in Luxembourg was bitter and correspondingly hard on the civilian population.
turn.7: What did the civilian population do?
turn.8: Over 2,100 homes in Luxembourg were destroyed in the fighting and more than 1,400 others seriously damaged.
turn.10: It is also estimated that some 500 Luxembourgish non-combatants lost their lives during the Battle of the Bulge.
turn.12: Besides the dead, over 45,000 Luxembourgers became refugees during the battle.
